content.rendered:
Source Code: https://github.com/IlyaHiguti/AuthMeTitle
Contributors:
IlyaHiguti

This plugin works with AuthMeReloaded only! Recomended to use this plugin on a separate authorization server.

Requirements:

  • Java 8
  • AuthMeReloaded

Commands:

  • /authmetitle – reload config (works only in the console)


config:

Code (Text):
Titles:
# Delay before sending uregister or login titles
# Recommended more than 20 ticks, because AuthMe takes some time to verify the player’s session
Delay_In_Ticks: 20
# All titles moved into separated config files
Hide_Players:
Enabled: true
# Show all player to players who are logged in
Show_Players:
Enabled: true
Delay_In_Ticks: 5
Tp_To_Spawn:
Enabled: false
# Move the player to the center of the block, like ‘XYZ: -24.500 / 60.000 / 13.500’
To_Center: true
# Name of the world
World: ‘world’
Yaw: 0
Pitch: 0
Show_Timeout_In_Experience:
Enabled: true
# Do you need to save the previous data about the experience of the players to restore this after authorization?
Save_Previous_Data: true


title_unregister:

Code (Text):
Repeat:
Enabled: true
# From which line should the loop begin after all the lines are played. The rows are counted from the index 0
Start_From: 52
Title:
# Each line is divided into parts using ” :: “. If you want to use these characters inside your titles, use ” :\: ”
# If you do not want to send any title or subtitle, just write ‘null’# “Title :: Subtitle :: fadeIn :: stay :: fadeOut :: Delay_Before_Sending_Next”
– ‘&4_                   _ ::  :: 0 :: 150 :: 0 :: 1’
– ‘&4_                  _ :: null :: 0 :: 150 :: 0 :: 1’

title_auth:

Code (Text):
Title:
# This title is called every time a player logs in or his session continues
# Each line is divided into parts using ” :: “. If you want to use these characters inside your titles, use ” :\: ”
# If you do not want to send any title or subtitle, just write ‘null’# “Title :: Subtitle :: fadeIn :: stay :: fadeOut :: Delay_Before_Sending_Next”
– ‘ ::  :: 20 :: 60 :: 20 :: 0’
